resources.string:
Enjoy the best sound quality, optimised for your headphones and your listening preferences.
This feature will analyse the connected headphones and your listening preferences when you play music. The sound experience will be optimised just for you.
Always get the best sound quality, optimised for your ears.
%s. In a list. Four items. To select an item, scroll horizontally from the centre of the screen.
Manually adjust the equaliser or other settings
Automatic optimisation is not available if DSEE HX is turned on. To enable this setting, please turn off DSEE HX.

The audio may skip or the data traffic via Wi-Fi may be disconnected due to network interference as the Bluetooth connection and Wi-Fi network use same frequency band (2.4 GHz).
To get a stable connection, try the following solutions: ・ Turn off Wi-Fi ・ Move to somewhere where there is no other network device using the 2.4 GHz band ・ Select [aptX]
Keep playing audio at a high bit-rate. The audio may skip when the Bluetooth connection becomes unstable.
Select an input/output device to connect (stereo mic STM10, noise cancelling headset)
This setting is not available if Auto-start is turned off. To enable this, please turn on Auto-start.
Suitable for watching a film or TV programme
This function is not available because another sound effect application with a higher priority is active. To enable the function, go to Settings > Sound > Music effects and enable Audio settings.
This function is not available because another sound effect application is active in higher priority. To enable the function, go to Settings > Apps and uninstall the application.
Play High-resolution Audio using USB DAC/DAC amp. When connected, sound effects become disabled.
This setting cannot be used with Dolby Atmos. Make sure that you turn off Dolby Atmos before using this setting.

The audio may skip or the data traffic via Wi-Fi may be disconnected due to network interference as the Bluetooth connection and Wi-Fi network use same frequency band (2.4 GHz).
To get a stable connection, try the following solutions: ・ Turn off Wi-Fi ・ Move to a place where there is no other network device using the 2.4 GHz band ・ Select [Best effort]
If you would like to keep the data traffic via Wi-Fi, select [Best effort]. Audio is played at the most appropriate bit rate depending on network environment.
Keep playing audio at a high bit-rate. The audio may skip when the Bluetooth connection becomes unstable.
Tap here to go to Noise cancelling settings
To analyse sound for a few seconds in order to optimise sound quality
Tap here to personalise sound quality
Minimise volume differences between songs or videos
Turn off Noise cancelling automatically when the screen is off and no music is playing
Suitable for recording a quiet sound or sound in a spacious room (e.g. lectures)
Suitable for recording a loud sound or sound near the device (e.g. rock concerts, close-up interviews)
Suitable for recording the sound of a normal conversation or sound within a short distance (e.g. house parties, meetings)

Removes noises from wind hitting the microphone when recording. Using Sony's sound separation technology based on machine learning, you can remove noise without losing the original audio quality. Only available when recording with the internal microphone.
To further upgrade your experience, you can optimise the sound to match your ears via the "Sony | Headphones Connect" app when using Sony certified headphones.
Personalise your smartphone in the 360 Reality Audio settings of Headphones Connect.

After personalisation via the 360 Reality Audio Setup menu in the "Sony | Headphones Connect" app, your personal profile will be applied to this Xperia. To return to the preset profile, turn off this setting.

You can select the codec for use when connected to the aptX HD device. If the audio skips or the data traffic via Wi-Fi is interrupted, tap [%s] to learn how to establish a stable connection between the devices.

You can enjoy Hi-Res Audio by connecting an LDAC device via Bluetooth connection. If the audio skips or the data traffic via Wi-Fi is interrupted, tap [%s] to learn how to establish a stable connection between the devices.

The audio may skip or data traffic via Wi-Fi may be disconnected due to network interference, as the Bluetooth connection and Wi-Fi network use the same frequency band (2.4 GHz).
For a stable connection, try the following solutions:
Turn Wi-Fi Off
Move to a place where there are no other network devices using the 2.4 GHz band
Select [Connection preferred]
If you would like to keep data traffic via Wi-Fi, select [Connection preferred].
